info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 10:21PM EDT until April 9 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties.
For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Killbuck Creek near Killbuck.
* WHEN...From late Saturday night to Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooded roads in and near Killbuck include Water Street, County Road 621, State Route 60 south, State Route 520, as well as local low lying roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 16.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 830 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO WEDNESDAY MORNING
